Category.desc: DISA ASD STIG
Category.name: APSC_DV

Category.desc: APSC_DV-001850 The application must not display passwords/PINs as clear text.
Category.name: APSC_DV-001850

Category.desc: APSC_DV-001750 The application must transmit only cryptographically-protected passwords.
Category.name: APSC_DV-001750

Category.desc: APSC_DV-000480 The application must enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system based on organization-defined information flow control policies.
Category.name: APSC_DV-000480

Category.desc: APSC_DV-000160 The application must implement DoD-approved encryption to protect the confidentiality of remote access sessions.
Category.name: APSC_DV-000160

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002460 The application must maintain the confidentiality and integrity of information during preparation for transmission.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002460

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002560 The application must not be subject to input handling vulnerabilities.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002560

Category.desc: APSC_DV-003110 The application must not contain embedded authentication data.
Category.name: APSC_DV-003110

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002000 The application must terminate all network connections associated with a communications session at the end of the session.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002000

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002440 The application must protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002440

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002540 The application must not be vulnerable to SQL Injection.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002540

Category.desc: APSC_DV-000500 The application must prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions to include disabling, circumventing, or altering implemented security safeguards/countermeasures.
Category.name: APSC_DV-000500

Category.desc: APSC_DV-001995 The application must not be vulnerable to race conditions.
Category.name: APSC_DV-001995

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002520 The application must protect from canonical representation vulnerabilities.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002520

Category.desc: APSC_DV-003235 The application must not be subject to error handling vulnerabilities.
Category.name: APSC_DV-003235

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002400 The application must restrict the ability to launch Denial of Service (DoS) attacks against itself or other information systems.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002400

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002290 The application must use the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) 140-2-validated cryptographic modules and random number generator if the application implements encryption, key exchange, digital signature, and hash functionality.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002290

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002390 XML-based applications must mitigate DoS attacks by using XML filters, parser options, or gateways.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002390

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002590 The application must not be vulnerable to overflow attacks.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002590

Category.desc: APSC_DV-000170 The application must implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the integrity of remote access sessions.
Category.name: APSC_DV-000170

Category.desc: APSC_DV-001300 The application must protect audit information from unauthorized deletion.
Category.name: APSC_DV-001300

Category.desc: APSC_DV-001740 The application must only store cryptographic representations of passwords.
Category.name: APSC_DV-001740

Category.desc: APSC_DV-000650 The application must not write sensitive data into the application logs.
Category.name: APSC_DV-000650

Category.desc: APSC_DV-001860 The application must use mechanisms meeting the requirements of applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance for authentication to a cryptographic module.
Category.name: APSC_DV-001860

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002470 The application must maintain the confidentiality and integrity of information during reception.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002470

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002350 The application must use appropriate cryptography in order to protect stored DoD information when required by the information owner or DoD policy.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002350

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002570 The application must generate error messages that provide information necessary for corrective actions without revealing information that could be exploited by adversaries.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002570

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002010 The application must implement NSA-approved cryptography to protect classified information in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002010

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002550 The application must not be vulnerable to XML-oriented attacks.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002550

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002530 The application must validate all input.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002530

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002510 The application must protect from command injection.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002510

Category.desc: APSC_DV-002480 The application must not disclose unnecessary information to users.
Category.name: APSC_DV-002480

Category.desc: APSC_DV-001290 The application must protect audit information from unauthorized modification.
Category.name: APSC_DV-001290

Category.desc: AUTOSAR C++14 Coding Guidelines
Category.name: AUTOSAR

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A16-6-1 #error directive shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A16_6_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-3-1 All overloads of a function shall be visible from where it is called
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M8-5-2 Braces shall be used to indicate and match the structure in the non-zero initialization of arrays and structures
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M8_5_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A6-5-1 A for-loop that loops through all elements of the container and does not use its loop-counter shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A6_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A25-4-1 Ordering predicates used with associative containers and STL sorting and related algorithms shall adhere to a strict weak ordering relation
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A25_4_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M15-1-1 The assignment-expression of a throw statement shall not itself cause an exception to be thrown
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M15_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M15-1-3 An empty throw (throw;) shall only be used in the compound statement of a catch handler
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M15_1_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M15-1-2 NULL shall not be thrown explicitly
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M15_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-7-1 If the behavior of a user-defined special member function is identical to implicitly defined special member function, then it shall be defined "=default" or be left undefined
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_7_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-3-2 The unary minus operator shall not be applied to an expression whose underlying type is unsigned
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_3_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-3-1 Each operand of the ! operator, the logical && or the logical || operators shall have type bool
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-3-4 Evaluation of the operand to the sizeof operator shall not contain side effects
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_3_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-3-3 The unary & operator shall not be overloaded
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_3_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-5-2 All user-defined conversion operators shall be defined explicit
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_5_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-5-3 User-defined conversion operators should not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_5_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A6-6-1 The goto statement shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A6_6_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M27-0-1 The stream input/output library <cstdio> shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M27_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-5-1 If "operator[]" is to be overloaded with a non-const version, const version shall also be implemented
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-16-1 The ternary conditional operator shall not be used as a sub-expression
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_16_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-5-4 If two opposite operators are defined, one shall be defined in terms of the other
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_5_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-5-5 Comparison operators shall be non-member functions with identical parameter types and noexcept
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_5_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A23-0-2 Elements of a container shall only be accessed via valid references, iterators, and pointers
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A23_0_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-1-4 If a function exits with an exception, then before a throw, the function shall place all objects/resources that the function constructed in valid states or it shall delete them
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_1_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A23-0-1 An iterator shall not be implicitly converted to const_iterator
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A23_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M4-5-3 Expressions with type (plain) char and wchar_t shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than the assignment operator =, the equality operators == and !=, and the unary & operator
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M4_5_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-1-5 Exceptions shall not be thrown across execution boundaries
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_1_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-17-1 The semantic equivalence between a binary operator and its assignment operator form shall be preserved
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_17_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-1-2 An exception object shall not be a pointer
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M4-5-1 Expressions with type bool shall not be used as operands to built-in operators other than the assignment operator =, the logical operators &&, ||, !, the equality operators == and !=, the unary & operator, and the conditional operator
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M4_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M0-1-10 Every defined function should be called at least once
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M0_1_10

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-1-1 Only instances of types derived from std::exception shall be thrown
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A10-4-1 Hierarchies should be based on interface classes
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A10_4_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A16-7-1 The #pragma directive shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A16_7_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A11-0-1 A non-POD type should be defined as class
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A11_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A11-0-2 A type defined as struct shall: (1) provide only public data members, (2) not provide any special member functions or methods, (3) not be a base of another struct or class, (4) not inherit from another struct or class
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A11_0_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-2-3 Enumerations shall be declared as scoped enum classes
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_2_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M8-4-4 A function identifier shall either be used to call the function or it shall be preceded by &
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M8_4_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-2-2 Enumeration underlying base type shall be explicitly defined
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_2_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-2-1 An expression with enum underlying type shall only have values corresponding to the enumerators of the enumeration
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M8-4-2 The identifiers used for the parameters in a re-declaration of a function shall be identical to those in the declaration
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M8_4_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-7-1 The character \ shall not occur as a last character of a C++ comment
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_7_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M3-9-1 The types used for an object, a function return type, or a function parameter shall be token-for-token identical in all declarations and re-declarations
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M3_9_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-7-3 All declarations of "user-defined" types, static and non-static data members, functions and methods shall be preceded by documentation using "///" comments and "@tag" tags
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_7_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-7-2 Sections of code shall not be "commented out"
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_7_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M12-1-1 An object's dynamic type shall not be used from the body of its constructor or destructor
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M12_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M3-9-3 The underlying bit representations of floating-point values shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M3_9_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A1-1-1 All code shall conform to ISO/IEC 14882:2014 - Programming Language C++ and shall not use deprecated features
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A1_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M3-1-2 Functions shall not be declared at block scope
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M3_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A6-4-1 A switch statement shall have at least two case-clauses, distinct from the default label
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A6_4_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-6-1 All class data members that are initialized by the constructor shall be initialized using member initializers
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_6_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M15-0-3 Control shall not be transferred into a try or catch block using a goto or a switch statement
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M15_0_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-2-6 A cast shall not convert a pointer to a function to any other pointer type, including a pointer to function type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_2_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-2-9 A cast shall not convert a pointer type to an integral type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_2_9

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M14-5-3 A copy assignment operator shall be declared when there is a template assignment operator with a parameter that is a generic parameter
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M14_5_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M18-2-1 The macro offsetof shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M18_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-2-8 An object with integer type or pointer to void type shall not be converted to an object with pointer type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_2_8

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-6-1 The right hand operand of the integer division or remainder operators shall not be equal to zero
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_6_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-2-3 Casts from a base class to a derived class should not be performed on polymorphic types
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_2_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-2-2 A pointer to a virtual base class shall only be cast to a pointer to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_2_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A6-5-3 Do statements should not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A6_5_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A6-5-2 A for loop shall contain a single loop-counter which shall not have floating-point type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A6_5_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-13-5 Hexadecimal constants should be upper case
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_13_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-13-6 Universal character names shall be used only inside character or string literals
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_13_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A6-5-4 For-init-statement and expression should not perform actions other than loop-counter initialization and modification
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A6_5_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-13-3 Type wchar_t shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_13_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-13-4 String literals shall not be assigned to non-constant pointers
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_13_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-13-1 Only those escape sequences that are defined in ISO/IEC 14882:2014 shall be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_13_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-13-2 String literals with different encoding prefixes shall not be concatenated
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_13_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-15 Array indexing shall be the only form of pointer arithmetic
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_15

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-16 A pointer operand and any pointer resulting from pointer arithmetic using that operand shall both address elements of the same array
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_16

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-17 Subtraction between pointers shall only be applied to pointers that address elements of the same array
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_17

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-18 >, >=, <, <= shall not be applied to objects of pointer type, except where they point to the same array
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_18

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-0-2 At least the basic guarantee for exception safety shall be provided for all operations. In addition, each function may offer either the strong guarantee or the nothrow guarantee
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_0_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M9-3-1 Const member functions shall not return non-const pointers or references to class-data
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M9_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-10 If the bitwise operators ~ and << are applied to an operand with an underlying type of unsigned char or unsigned short, the result shall be immediately cast to the underlying type of the operand
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_10

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M9-3-3 If a member function can be made static then it shall be made static, otherwise if it can be made const then it shall be made const
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M9_3_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-11 The plain char type shall only be used for the storage and use of character values
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_11

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-12 Signed char and unsigned char type shall only be used for the storage and use of numeric values
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_12

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-14 The first operand of a conditional-operator shall have type bool
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_14

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M7-1-2 A pointer or reference parameter in a function shall be declared as pointer to const or reference to const if the corresponding object is not modified
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M7_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-1-4 The register keyword shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_1_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-1-3 CV-qualifiers shall be placed on the right hand side of the type that is a typedef or a using name
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_1_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-1-2 The constexpr specifier shall be used for values that can be determined at compile time
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-1-1 Constexpr or const specifiers shall be used for immutable data declaration
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-8-1 A header file name shall be identical to a type name declared in it if it declares a type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_8_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-11-1 Volatile keyword shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_11_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A9-5-1 Unions shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A9_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-3-1 The statement forming the body of a switch, while, do ... while or for statement shall be a compound statement
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-20 Non-constant operands to a binary bitwise operator shall have the same underlying type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_20

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-21 Bitwise operators shall only be applied to operands of unsigned underlying type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_21

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-0-1 The C library facilities shall only be accessed through C++ library headers
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-0-3 The library <clocale> (locale.h) and the setlocale function shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_0_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M0-4-2 Use of floating-point arithmetic shall be documented
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M0_4_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-0-2 The error state of a conversion from string to a numeric value shall be checked
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_0_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-3-1 A function that contains "forwarding reference" as its argument shall not be overloaded
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-5-1 A pointer to member shall not access non-existent class members
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M14-6-1 In a class template with a dependent base, any name that may be found in that dependent base shall be referred to using a qualified-id or this->
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M14_6_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A0-4-2 Type long double shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A0_4_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A0-4-4 Range, domain and pole errors shall be checked when using math functions
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A0_4_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A4-7-1 An integer expression shall not lead to data loss
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A4_7_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-2-5 Enumerations should be used to represent sets of related named constants
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_2_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-2-4 In an enumeration, either (1) none, (2) the first or (3) all enumerators shall be initialized
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_2_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A20-8-6 std::make_shared shall be used to construct objects owned by std::shared_ptr
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A20_8_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A20-8-5 std::make_unique shall be used to construct objects owned by std::unique_ptr
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A20_8_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A20-8-7 A std::weak_ptr shall be used to represent temporary shared ownership
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A20_8_7

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A20-8-2 A std::unique_ptr shall be used to represent exclusive ownership
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A20_8_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A20-8-1 An already-owned pointer value shall not be stored in an unrelated smart pointer
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A20_8_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A20-8-4 A std::unique_ptr shall be used over std::shared_ptr if ownership sharing is not required
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A20_8_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A20-8-3 A std::shared_ptr shall be used to represent shared ownership
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A20_8_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A9-6-1 Data types used for interfacing with hardware or conforming to communication protocols shall be trivial, standard-layout and only contain members of types with defined sizes
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A9_6_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-2-3 Before preprocessing, a null statement shall only occur on a line by itself; it may be followed by a comment, provided that the first character following the null statement is a white-space character
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_2_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-2-2 Floating-point expressions shall not be directly or indirectly tested for equality or inequality
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_2_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-4-1 Destructor of a base class shall be public virtual, public override or protected non-virtual
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_4_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-10-1 An identifier declared in an inner scope shall not hide an identifier declared in an outer scope
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_10_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-2-1 Assignment operators shall not be used in sub-expressions
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A6-2-2 Expression statements shall not be explicit calls to constructors of temporary objects only
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A6_2_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A6-2-1 Move and copy assignment operators shall either move or respectively copy base classes and data members of a class, without any side effects
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A6_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A9-6-2 Bit-fields shall be used only when interfacing to hardware or conforming to communication protocols
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A9_6_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-4-2 If a public destructor of a class is non-virtual, then the class should be declared final
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_4_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-5-11 "operator new" and "operator delete" shall be defined together
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_5_11

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-11 A smart pointer shall only be used as a parameter type if it expresses lifetime semantics
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_11

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-5-10 Placement new shall be used only with properly aligned pointers to sufficient storage capacity
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_5_10

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-10 A parameter shall be passed by reference if it can't be NULL
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_10

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-13 A std::shared_ptr shall be passed to a function as: (1) a copy to express the function shares ownership (2) an lvalue reference to express that the function replaces the managed object (3) a const lvalue reference to express that the function retains a reference count
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_13

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-12 A std::unique_ptr shall be passed to a function as: (1) a copy to express the function assumes ownership (2) an lvalue reference to express that the function replaces the managed object
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_12

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-1-2 The std::vector<bool> specialization shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-1-1 C-style arrays shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-2-1 An assignment operator shall return a reference to "this"
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-1-4 A pointer pointing to an element of an array of objects shall not be passed to a smart pointer of single object type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_1_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M18-0-3 The library functions abort, exit, getenv and system from library <cstdlib> shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M18_0_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-2-2 A binary arithmetic operator and a bitwise operator shall return a "prvalue"
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_2_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-1-3 The std::auto_ptr type shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_1_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-1-6 All std::hash specializations for user-defined types shall have a noexcept function call operator
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_1_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-2-3 A relational operator shall return a boolean value
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_2_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M18-0-5 The unbounded functions of library <cstring> shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M18_0_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M18-0-4 The time handling functions of library <ctime> shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M18_0_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M2-10-1 Different identifiers shall be typographically unambiguous
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M2_10_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-14-1 The right hand operand of a logical &&, || operators shall not contain side effects
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_14_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-1-9 A class, structure, or enumeration shall not be declared in the definition of its type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_1_9

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-1-8 A non-type specifier shall be placed before a type specifier in a declaration
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_1_8

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-1-7 Each expression statement and identifier declaration shall be placed on a separate line
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_1_7

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-1-6 The typedef specifier shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_1_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-1-5 The auto specifier shall not be used apart from following cases: (1) to declare that a variable has the same type as return type of a function call, (2) to declare that a variable has the same type as initializer of non-fundamental type, (3) to declare parameters of a generic lambda expression, (4) to declare a function template using trailing return type syntax
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_1_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-9-2 Forwarding values to other functions shall be done via: (1) std::move if the value is an rvalue reference, (2) std::forward if the value is forwarding reference
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_9_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-9-1 The std::bind shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_9_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-9-4 An argument to std::forward shall not be subsequently used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_9_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-9-3 The std::move shall not be used on objects declared const or const&
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_9_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A14-8-2 Explicit specializations of function templates shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A14_8_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A3-8-1 An object shall not be accessed outside of its lifetime
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A3_8_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M16-3-2 The # and ## operators should not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M16_3_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-5-4 If a class has a user-declared constructor that takes a parameter of type std::initializer_list, then it shall be the only constructor apart from special member function constructors
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_5_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M16-3-1 There shall be at most one occurrence of the # or ## operators in a single macro definition
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M16_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M7-3-2 The identifier main shall not be used for a function other than the global function main
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M7_3_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M7-3-1 The global namespace shall only contain main, namespace declarations and extern "C" declarations
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M7_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A16-2-1 The ', ", /*, //, \ characters shall not occur in a header file name or in #include directive
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A16_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-5-1 In an initialization list, the order of initialization shall be following: (1) virtual base classes in depth and left to right order of the inheritance graph, (2) direct base classes in left to right order of inheritance list, (3) non-static data members in the order they were declared in the class definition
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M7-3-4 Using-directives shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M7_3_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-5-0 All memory shall be initialized before it is read
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_5_0

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M7-3-3 There shall be no unnamed namespaces in header files
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M7_3_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-5-3 A variable of type auto shall not be initialized using {} or ={} braced-initialization
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_5_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M7-3-6 Using-directives and using-declarations (excluding class scope or function scope using-declarations) shall not be used in header files
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M7_3_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A16-2-2 There shall be no unused include directives
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A16_2_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-5-2 Braced-initialization {}, without equals sign, shall be used for variable initialization
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_5_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A17-0-1 Reserved identifiers, macros and functions in the C++ standard library shall not be defined, redefined or undefined
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A17_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A9-3-1 Member functions shall not return non-const "raw" pointers or references to private or protected data owned by the class
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A9_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-5-5 A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or expression
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_5_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-5-4 The loop-counter shall be modified by one of: --, ++, -= n, or += n; where n remains constant for the duration of the loop
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_5_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M3-4-1 An identifier declared to be an object or type shall be defined in a block that minimizes its visibility
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M3_4_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-5-3 The loop-counter shall not be modified within condition or statement
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_5_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-5-2 If loop-counter is not modified by -- or ++, then, within condition, the loop-counter shall only be used as an operand to <=, <, > or >=
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_5_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-5-6 A loop-control-variable other than the loop-counter which is modified in statement shall have type bool
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_5_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-1-2 User defined suffixes of the user defined literal operators shall start with underscore followed by one or more letters
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M0-2-1 An object shall not be assigned to an overlapping object
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M0_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M4-10-1 NULL shall not be used as an integer value
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M4_10_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-1-3 User defined literals operators shall only perform conversion of passed parameters
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_1_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-3-3 Pointers to incomplete class types shall not be deleted
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_3_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-3-2 Null pointers shall not be dereferenced
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_3_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-3-1 Evaluation of the operand to the typeid operator shall not contain side effects
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M18-7-1 The signal handling facilities of <csignal> shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M18_7_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A26-5-1 Pseudorandom numbers shall not be generated using std::rand()
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A26_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M4-10-2 Literal zero (0) shall not be used as the null-pointer-constant
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M4_10_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-10-6 A class or enumeration name shall not be hidden by a variable, function or enumerator declaration in the same scope
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_10_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A26-5-2 Random number engines shall not be default-initialized
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A26_5_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-10-4 The identifier name of a non-member object with static storage duration or static function shall not be reused within a namespace
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_10_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-10-5 An identifier name of a function with static storage duration or a non-member object with external or internal linkage should not be reused
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_10_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A4-5-1 Expressions with type enum or enum class shall not be used as operands to built-in and overloaded operators other than the subscript operator [ ], the assignment operator =, the equality operators == and !=, the unary & operator, and the relational operators <, <=, >, >=
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A4_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-5-3 The std::terminate() function shall not be called implicitly
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_5_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-5-2 Program shall not be abruptly terminated. In particular, an implicit or explicit invocation of std::abort(), std::quick_exit(), std::_Exit(), std::terminate() shall not be done
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_5_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-5-1 All user-provided class destructors, deallocation functions, move constructors, move assignment operators and swap functions shall not exit with an exception. A noexcept exception specification shall be added to these functions as appropriate
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M9-6-4 Named bit-fields with signed integer type shall have a length of more than one bit
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M9_6_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-2-10 The increment (++) and decrement (--) operators shall not be mixed with other operators in an expression
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_2_10

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-2-12 An identifier with array type passed as a function argument shall not decay to a pointer
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_2_12

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-2-11 The comma operator, && operator and the || operator shall not be overloaded
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_2_11

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A14-7-2 Template specialization shall be declared in the same file (1) as the primary template (2) as a user-defined type, for which the specialization is declared
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A14_7_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A3-9-1 Fixed width integer types from <cstdint>, indicating the size and signedness, shall be used in place of the basic numerical types
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A3_9_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M16-2-3 Include guards shall be provided
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M16_2_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A3-1-6 Trivial accessor and mutator functions should be inlined
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A3_1_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A3-1-5 A function definition shall only be placed in a class definition if (1) the function is intended to be inlined (2) it is a member function template (3) it is a member function of a class template
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A3_1_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A3-1-4 When an array with external linkage is declared, its size shall be stated explicitly
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A3_1_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A3-1-3 Implementation files, that are defined locally in the project, should have a file name extension of ".cpp"
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A3_1_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A3-1-2 Header files, that are defined locally in the project, shall have a file name extension of one of: ".h", ".hpp" or ".hxx"
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A3_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A3-1-1 It shall be possible to include any header file in multiple translation units without violating the One Definition Rule
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A3_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-3-1 Only those characters specified in the C++ Language Standard basic source character set shall be used in the source code
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M10-1-2 A base class shall only be declared virtual if it is used in a diamond hierarchy
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M10_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M10-1-1 Classes should not be derived from virtual bases
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M10_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M8-0-1 An init-declarator-list or a member-declarator-list shall consist of a single init-declarator or member-declarator respectively
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M8_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-4-2 All if ... else if constructs shall be terminated with an else clause
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_4_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-4-1 An if ( condition ) construct shall be followed by a compound statement. The else keyword shall be followed by either a compound statement, or another if statement
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_4_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A17-1-1 Use of the C Standard Library shall be encapsulated and isolated
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A17_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A21-8-1 Arguments to character-handling functions shall be representable as an unsigned char
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A21_8_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M10-1-3 An accessible base class shall not be both virtual and non-virtual in the same hierarchy
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M10_1_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-4-6 The final clause of a switch statement shall be the default-clause
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_4_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A25-1-1 Non-static data members or captured values of predicate function objects that are state related to this object's identity shall not be copied
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A25_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-4-5 An unconditional throw or break statement shall terminate every non-empty switch-clause
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_4_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-4-4 A switch-label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_4_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-4-3 A switch statement shall be a well-formed switch statement
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_4_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M2-7-1 The character sequence /* shall not be used within a C-style comment
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M2_7_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-4-7 The condition of a switch statement shall not have bool type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_4_7

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-2-1 dynamic_cast should not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M0-3-2 If a function generates error information, then that error information shall be tested
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M0_3_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-2-5 An array or container shall not be accessed beyond its range
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_2_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M0-3-1 Minimization of run-time failures shall be ensured by the use of at least one of: (a) static analysis tools/techniques; (b) dynamic analysis tools/techniques; (c) explicit coding of checks to handle run-time faults
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M0_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-2-4 reinterpret_cast shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_2_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-2-3 A cast shall not remove any const or volatile qualification from the type of a pointer or reference
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_2_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-2-2 Traditional C-style casts shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_2_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-4-5 Checked exceptions that could be thrown from a function shall be specified together with the function declaration and they shall be identical in all function declarations and for all its overriders
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_4_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M17-0-2 The names of standard library macros and objects shall not be reused
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M17_0_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-4-3 The noexcept specification of a function shall either be identical across all translation units, or identical or more restrictive between a virtual member function and an overrider
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_4_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-4-4 A declaration of non-throwing function shall contain noexcept specification
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_4_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M17-0-3 The names of standard library functions shall not be overridden
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M17_0_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-4-1 Dynamic exception-specification shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_4_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-4-2 If a function is declared to be noexcept, noexcept(true) or noexcept(<true condition>), then it shall not exit with an exception
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_4_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A10-1-1 Class shall not be derived from more than one base class which is not an interface class
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A10_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M17-0-5 The setjmp macro and the longjmp function shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M17_0_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M16-1-2 All #else, #elif and #endif pre-processor directives shall reside in the same file as the #if or #ifdef directive to which they are related
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M16_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A11-3-1 Friend declarations shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A11_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M16-1-1 The defined pre-processor operator shall only be used in one of the two standard forms
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M16_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M7-5-2 The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be assigned to another object that may persist after the first object has ceased to exist
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M7_5_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M7-5-1 A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to an automatic variable (including parameters), defined within the function
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M7_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M3-2-4 An identifier with external linkage shall have exactly one definition
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M3_2_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A16-0-1 The pre-processor shall only be used for unconditional and conditional file inclusion and include guards, and using the following directives: (1) #ifndef, (2) #ifdef, (3) #if, (4) #if defined, (5) #elif, (6) #else, (7) #define, (8) #endif, (9) #include
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A16_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M10-2-1 All accessible entity names within a multiple inheritance hierarchy should be unique
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M10_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M8-3-1 Parameters in an overriding virtual function shall either use the same default arguments as the function they override, or else shall not specify any default arguments
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M8_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-1-1 Constructors shall explicitly initialize all virtual base classes, all direct non-virtual base classes and all non-static data members
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-1-2 Both NSDMI and a non-static member initializer in a constructor shall not be used in the same type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M15-3-4 Each exception explicitly thrown in the code shall have a handler of a compatible type in all call paths that could lead to that point
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M15_3_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-1-3 If all user-defined constructors of a class initialize data members with constant values that are the same across all constructors, then data members shall be initialized using NSDMI instead
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_1_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M15-3-7 Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block, any ellipsis (catch-all) handler shall occur last
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M15_3_7

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-1-4 All constructors that are callable with a single argument of fundamental type shall be declared explicit
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_1_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M15-3-6 Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block for a derived class and some or all of its bases, the handlers shall be ordered most-derived to base class
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M15_3_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M3-2-1 All declarations of an object or function shall have compatible types
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M3_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A17-6-1 Non-standard entities shall not be added to standard namespaces
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A17_6_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M3-2-3 A type, object or function that is used in multiple translation units shall be declared in one and only one file
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M3_2_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-10-1 A pointer to member virtual function shall only be tested for equality with null-pointer-constant
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_10_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M3-2-2 The One Definition Rule shall not be violated
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M3_2_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-2-6 The operands of a logical && or || shall be parenthesized if the operands contain binary operators
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_2_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-1-5 Common class initialization for non-constant members shall be done by a delegating constructor
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_1_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M15-3-1 Exceptions shall be raised only after start-up and before termination
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M15_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-1-6 Derived classes that do not need further explicit initialization and require all the constructors from the base class shall use inheriting constructors
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_1_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M15-3-3 Handlers of a function-try-block implementation of a class constructor or destructor shall not reference non-static members from this class or its bases
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M15_3_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M11-0-1 Member data in non-POD class types shall be private
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M11_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-1-2 Variables shall not be implicitly captured in a lambda expression
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-1-1 Literal values shall not be used apart from type initialization, otherwise symbolic names shall be used instead
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A4-10-1 Only nullptr literal shall be used as the null-pointer-constant
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A4_10_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-1-6 Return type of a non-void return type lambda expression should be explicitly specified
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_1_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-1-4 A lambda expression object shall not outlive any of its reference-captured objects
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_1_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-1-3 Parameter list (possibly empty) shall be included in every lambda expression
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_1_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-3-4 Catch-all (ellipsis and std::exception) handlers shall be used only in (a) main, (b) task main functions, (c) in functions that are supposed to isolate independent components and (d) when calling third-party code that uses exceptions not according to AUTOSAR C++14 guidelines
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_3_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-3-5 A class type exception shall be caught by reference or const reference
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_3_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-3-2 If a function throws an exception, it shall be handled when meaningful actions can be taken, otherwise it shall be propagated
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_3_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M2-13-2 Octal constants (other than zero) and octal escape sequences (other than "\0" ) shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M2_13_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-3-3 Main function and a task main function shall catch at least: base class exceptions from all third-party libraries used, std::exception and all otherwise unhandled exceptions
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_3_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-6-1 Functions declared with the [[noreturn]] attribute shall not return
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_6_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M2-13-4 Literal suffixes shall be upper case
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M2_13_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M2-13-3 A "U" suffix shall be applied to all octal or hexadecimal integer literals of unsigned type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M2_13_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-19-1 Evaluation of constant unsigned integer expressions shall not lead to wrap-around
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_19_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A14-5-1 A template constructor shall not participate in overload resolution for a single argument of the enclosing class type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A14_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A10-2-1 Non-virtual member functions shall not be redefined in derived classes
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A10_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-2-1 When declaring function templates, the trailing return type syntax shall be used if the return type depends on the type of parameters
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A14-5-3 A non-member generic operator shall only be declared in a namespace that does not contain class (struct) type, enum type or union type declarations.
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A14_5_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-6 "forward" parameters declared as T && shall always be forwarded
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M16-0-5 Arguments to a function-like macro shall not contain tokens that look like pre-processing directives
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M16_0_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-5 "consume" parameters declared as X && shall always be moved from
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-8 Output parameters shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_8

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M7-4-1 All usage of assembler shall be documented
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M7_4_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-7 "in" parameters for "cheap to copy" types shall be passed by value
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_7

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M16-0-2 Macros shall only be #define'd or #undef'd in the global namespace
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M16_0_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-8-6 Copy and move constructors and copy assignment and move assignment operators shall be declared protected or defined "=delete" in base class
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_8_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A3-3-2 Static and thread-local objects shall be constant-initialized
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A3_3_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-2 All exit paths from a function with non-void return type shall have an explicit return statement with an expression
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M16-0-1 #include directives in a file shall only be preceded by other pre-processor directives or comments
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M16_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M7-4-3 Assembly language shall be encapsulated and isolated
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M7_4_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-8-7 Assignment operators should be declared with the ref-qualifier &
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_8_7

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A3-3-1 Objects or functions with external linkage (including members of named namespaces) shall be declared in a header file
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A3_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-1 Functions shall not be defined using the ellipsis notation
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M7-4-2 Assembler instructions shall only be introduced using the asm declaration
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M7_4_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-4 Multiple output values from a function should be returned as a struct or tuple
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-3 Common ways of passing parameters should be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-4-1 The asm declaration shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_4_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-5-1 Trigraphs shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A2-5-2 Digraphs shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A2_5_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A8-4-9 "in-out" parameters declared as T & shall be modified
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A8_4_9

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M16-0-8 If the # token appears as the first token on a line, then it shall be immediately followed by a pre-processing token
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M16_0_8

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M16-0-7 Undefined macro identifiers shall not be used in #if or #elif pre-processor directives, except as operands to the defined operator
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M16_0_7

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M16-0-6 In the definition of a function-like macro, each instance of a parameter shall be enclosed in parentheses, unless it is used as the operand of # or ##
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M16_0_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-0-2 Bitwise operations and operations that assume data representation in memory shall not be performed on objects
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_0_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M10-3-3 A virtual function shall only be overridden by a pure virtual function if it is itself declared as pure virtual
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M10_3_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-6-3 The continue statement shall only be used within a well-formed for loop
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_6_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M3-3-2 If a function has internal linkage then all re-declarations shall include the static storage class specifier
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M3_3_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-6-2 The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function body
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_6_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-0-1 If a class declares a copy or move operation, or a destructor, either via "=default", "=delete", or via a user-provided declaration, then all others of these five special member functions shall be declared as well
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M6-6-1 Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in a block enclosing the goto statement
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M6_6_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-8-2 User-defined copy and move assignment operators should use user-defined no-throw swap function
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_8_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-8-3 Moved-from object shall not be read-accessed
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_8_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-8-4 Move constructor shall not initialize its class members and base classes using copy semantics
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_8_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-1-8 Lambda expressions should not be defined inside another lambda expression
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_1_8

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-8-5 A copy assignment and a move assignment operators shall handle self-assignment
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_8_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-1-7 A lambda shall not be an operand to decltype or typeid
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_1_7

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M19-3-1 The error indicator errno shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M19_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A12-8-1 Move and copy constructors shall move and respectively copy base classes and data members of a class, without any side effects
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A12_8_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-0-3 The declaration of objects shall contain no more than two levels of pointer indirection
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_0_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-9 An explicit integral conversion shall not change the signedness of the underlying type of a cvalue expression
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_9

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-8-1 The right hand operand of a shift operator shall lie between zero and one less than the width in bits of the underlying type of the left hand operand
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_8_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A0-1-1 A project shall not contain instances of non-volatile variables being given values that are not subsequently used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A0_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-0-2 The condition of an if-statement and the condition of an iteration statement shall have type bool
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_0_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-8 An explicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not increase the size of the underlying type of a cvalue expression
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_8

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A0-1-2 The value returned by a function having a non-void return type that is not an overloaded operator shall be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A0_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-0-1 The value of an expression shall be the same under any order of evaluation that the standard permits
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M0-1-4 A project shall not contain non-volatile POD variables having only one use
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M0_1_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A0-1-3 Every function defined in an anonymous namespace, or static function with internal linkage, or private member function shall be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A0_1_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M0-1-2 A project shall not contain infeasible paths
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M0_1_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-5 There shall be no implicit floating-integral conversions
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A27-0-4 C-style strings shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A27_0_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M0-1-3 A project shall not contain unused variables
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M0_1_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-4 An implicit integral conversion shall not change the signedness of the underlying type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-5-2 Non-placement new or delete expressions shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_5_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A27-0-3 Alternate input and output operations on a file stream shall not be used without an intervening flush or positioning call
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A27_0_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-7 There shall be no explicit floating-integral conversions of a cvalue expression
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_7

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-5-1 Functions malloc, calloc, realloc and free shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A27-0-2 A C-style string shall guarantee sufficient space for data and the null terminator
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A27_0_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A5-0-4 Pointer arithmetic shall not be used with pointers to non-final classes
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A5_0_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M0-1-1 A project shall not contain unreachable code
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M0_1_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-6 An implicit integral or floating-point conversion shall not reduce the size of the underlying type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A13-6-1 Digit sequences separators ' shall only be used as follows: (1) for decimal, every 3 digits, (2) for hexadecimal, every 2 digits, (3) for binary, every 4 digits
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A13_6_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A27-0-1 Inputs from independent components shall be validated
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A27_0_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A0-1-4 There shall be no unused named parameters in non-virtual functions
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A0_1_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A0-1-5 There shall be no unused named parameters in the set of parameters for a virtual function and all the functions that override it
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A0_1_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A0-1-6 There should be no unused type declarations
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A0_1_6

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A10-3-5 A user-defined assignment operator shall not be virtual
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A10_3_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A15-2-1 Constructors that are not noexcept shall not be invoked before program startup
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A15_2_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-5-2 Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_5_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-18-1 The comma operator shall not be used
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_18_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A7-5-1 A function shall not return a reference or a pointer to a parameter that is passed by reference to const
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A7_5_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-5-4 If a project has sized or unsized version of operator "delete" globally defined, then both sized and unsized versions shall be defined
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_5_4

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-5-3 The form of the delete expression shall match the form of the new expression used to allocate the memory
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_5_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-3 A cvalue expression shall not be implicitly converted to a different underlying type
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-5-5 Memory management functions shall ensure the following: (a) deterministic behavior resulting with the existence of worst-case execution time, (b) avoiding memory fragmentation, (c) avoid running out of memory, (d) avoiding mismatched allocations or deallocations, (e) no dependence on non-deterministic calls to kernel
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_5_5

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M5-0-2 Limited dependence should be placed on C++ operator precedence rules in expressions
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M5_0_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A10-3-1 Virtual function declaration shall contain exactly one of the three specifiers:
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A10_3_1

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-5-8 Objects that do not outlive a function shall have automatic storage duration
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_5_8

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A10-3-2 Each overriding virtual function shall be declared with the override or final specifier
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A10_3_2

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A10-3-3 Virtual functions shall not be introduced in a final class
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A10_3_3

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M0-1-8 All functions with void return type shall have external side effect(s)
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M0_1_8

Category.desc: AUTOSAR A18-5-9 Custom implementations of dynamic memory allocation and deallocation functions shall meet the semantic requirements specified in the corresponding "Required behaviour" clause from the C++ Standard
Category.name: AUTOSAR-A18_5_9

Category.desc: AUTOSAR M0-1-9 There shall be no dead code
Category.name: AUTOSAR-M0_1_9

Category.desc: CERT-MSC14_C (REC) Do not introduce unnecessary platform dependencies
Category.name: CERT_C-MSC14

Category.desc: CERT-MSC13_C (REC) Detect and remove unused values

Category.desc: CERT-MSC15_C (REC) Do not depend on undefined behavior
Category.name: CERT_C-MSC15

Category.desc: CERT-WIN00_C (REC) Be specific when dynamically loading libraries

Category.desc: CERT-FLP03_C (REC) Detect and handle floating-point errors
Category.name: CERT_C-FLP03

Category.name: CERT_C-MSC17

Category.name: CERT_C-FLP02

Category.name: CERT_C-MSC19

Category.desc: CERT-FLP06_C (REC) Convert integers to floating point for floating-point operations
Category.name: CERT_C-FLP06

Category.desc: CERT-INT02_C (REC) Understand integer conversion rules
Category.name: CERT_C-INT02

Category.desc: CERT-FLP00_C (REC) Understand the limitations of floating-point numbers
Category.name: CERT_C-FLP00

Category.desc: CERT-API01_C (REC) Avoid laying out strings in memory directly before sensitive data
Category.name: CERT_C-API01

Category.desc: CERT-API02_C (REC) Functions that read or write to or from an array should take an argument to specify the source or target size
Category.name: CERT_C-API02

Category.name: CERT_C-INT08

Category.desc: CERT-INT09_C (REC) Ensure enumeration constants map to unique values
Category.name: CERT_C-INT09

Category.desc: CERT-INT07_C (REC) Use only explicitly signed or unsigned char type for numeric values
Category.name: CERT_C-INT07

Category.desc: CERT-INT04_C (REC) Enforce limits on integer values originating from tainted sources
Category.name: CERT_C-INT04

Category.desc: CERT-INT05_C (REC) Do not use input functions to convert character data if they cannot handle all possible inputs
Category.name: CERT_C-INT05

Category.name: CERT_C-ENV30

Category.name: CERT_C-MSC22

Category.desc: CERT-MSC24_C (REC) Do not use deprecated or obsolescent functions
Category.name: CERT_C-MSC24

Category.desc: CERT-INT13_C (REC) Use bitwise operators only on unsigned operands
Category.name: CERT_C-INT13

Category.desc: CERT-INT12_C (REC) Do not make assumptions about the type of a plain int bit-field when used in an expression
Category.name: CERT_C-INT12

Category.name: CERT_C-INT10

Category.desc: CERT-ENV33_C (RULE) Do not call system()
Category.name: CERT_C-ENV33

Category.desc: CERT-INT18_C (REC) Evaluate integer expressions in a larger size before comparing or assigning to that size

Category.desc: CERT-INT15_C (REC) Use intmax_t or uintmax_t for formatted IO on programmer-defined integer types
Category.name: CERT_C-INT15

Category.desc: CERT-MSC30_C (RULE) Do not use the rand() function for generating pseudorandom numbers
Category.name: CERT_C-MSC30

Category.desc: CERT-ENV32_C (RULE) All exit handlers must return normally
Category.name: CERT_C-ENV32

Category.desc: CERT-INT16_C (REC) Do not make assumptions about representation of signed integers
Category.name: CERT_C-INT16

Category.desc: CERT-MEM00_C (REC) Allocate and free memory in the same module, at the same level of abstraction
Category.name: CERT_C-MEM00

Category.desc: CERT-MEM01_C (REC) Store a new value in pointers immediately after free()
Category.name: CERT_C-MEM01

Category.desc: CERT-SIG30_C (RULE) Call only asynchronous-safe functions within signal handlers
Category.name: CERT_C-SIG30

Category.desc: CERT-MEM04_C (REC) Beware of zero-length allocations
Category.name: CERT_C-MEM04

Category.desc: CERT-MEM05_C (REC) Avoid large stack allocations
Category.name: CERT_C-MEM05

Category.desc: CERT-SIG31_C (RULE) Do not access shared objects in signal handlers
Category.name: CERT_C-SIG31

Category.desc: CERT-MEM02_C (REC) Immediately cast the result of a memory allocation function call into a pointer to the allocated type
Category.name: CERT_C-MEM02

Category.desc: CERT-SIG34_C (RULE) Do not call signal() from within interruptible signal handlers
Category.name: CERT_C-SIG34

Category.desc: CERT-MEM03_C (REC) Clear sensitive information stored in reusable resources
Category.name: CERT_C-MEM03

Category.desc: CERT-SIG35_C (RULE) Do not return from a computational exception signal handler
Category.name: CERT_C-SIG35

Category.desc: CERT-PRE31_C (RULE) Avoid side effects in arguments to unsafe macros
Category.name: CERT_C-PRE31

Category.desc: CERT-PRE32_C (RULE) Do not use preprocessor directives in invocations of function-like macros
Category.name: CERT_C-PRE32

Category.desc: CERT-PRE30_C (RULE) Do not create a universal character name through concatenation
Category.name: CERT_C-PRE30

Category.desc: CERT-ENV02_C (REC) Beware of multiple environment variables with the same effective name
Category.name: CERT_C-ENV02

Category.desc: CERT-ENV01_C (REC) Do not make assumptions about the size of an environment variable
Category.name: CERT_C-ENV01

Category.desc: CERT-MSC01_C (REC) Strive for logical completeness
Category.name: CERT_C-MSC01

Category.desc: CERT-MSC04_C (REC) Use comments consistently and in a readable fashion
Category.name: CERT_C-MSC04

Category.desc: CERT-MSC07_C (REC) Detect and remove dead code
Category.name: CERT_C-MSC07

Category.desc: CERT-MSC09_C (REC) Character encoding: Use subset of ASCII for safety
Category.name: CERT_C-MSC09

Category.desc: CERT-INT35_C (RULE) Use correct integer precisions
Category.name: CERT_C-INT35

Category.desc: CERT-INT36_C (RULE) Converting a pointer to integer or integer to pointer
Category.name: CERT_C-INT36

Category.desc: CERT-INT33_C (RULE) Ensure that division and remainder operations do not result in divide-by-zero errors
Category.name: CERT_C-INT33

Category.desc: CERT-INT34_C (RULE) Do not shift an expression by a negative number of bits or by greater than or equal to the number of bits that exist in the operand
Category.name: CERT_C-INT34

Category.desc: CERT-INT31_C (RULE) Ensure that integer conversions do not result in lost or misinterpreted data
Category.name: CERT_C-INT31

Category.desc: CERT-INT32_C (RULE) Ensure that operations on signed integers do not result in overflow
Category.name: CERT_C-INT32

Category.desc: CERT-INT30_C (RULE) Ensure that unsigned integer operations do not wrap
Category.name: CERT_C-INT30

Category.desc: CERT-FIO34_C (RULE) Distinguish between characters read from a file and EOF or WEOF
Category.name: CERT_C-FIO34

Category.desc: CERT-FIO32_C (RULE) Do not perform operations on devices that are only appropriate for files
Category.name: CERT_C-FIO32

Category.desc: CERT-FIO38_C (RULE) Do not copy a FILE object
Category.name: CERT_C-FIO38

Category.name: CERT_C-FIO39

Category.name: CERT_C-FIO37

Category.name: CERT_C-EXP44

Category.desc: CERT-EXP45_C (RULE) Do not perform assignments in selection statements
Category.name: CERT_C-EXP45

Category.desc: CERT-EXP42_C (RULE) Do not compare padding data
Category.name: CERT_C-EXP42

Category.desc: CERT-EXP43_C (RULE) Avoid undefined behavior when using restrict-qualified pointers
Category.name: CERT_C-EXP43

Category.desc: CERT-FIO30_C (RULE) Exclude user input from format strings
Category.name: CERT_C-FIO30

Category.desc: CERT-EXP46_C (RULE) Do not use a bitwise operator with a Boolean-like operand
Category.name: CERT_C-EXP46

Category.desc: CERT-EXP47_C (RULE) Do not call va_arg with an argument of the incorrect type
Category.name: CERT_C-EXP47

Category.desc: CERT-MEM12_C (REC) Consider using a goto chain when leaving a function on error when using and releasing resources
Category.name: CERT_C-MEM12

Category.desc: CERT-STR34_C (RULE) Cast characters to unsigned char before converting to larger integer sizes
Category.name: CERT_C-STR34

Category.desc: CERT-STR31_C (RULE) Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator
Category.name: CERT_C-STR31

Category.desc: CERT-STR32_C (RULE) Do not pass a non-null-terminated character sequence to a library function that expects a string
Category.name: CERT_C-STR32

Category.desc: CERT-STR30_C (RULE) Do not attempt to modify string literals
Category.name: CERT_C-STR30

Category.desc: CERT-FIO45_C (RULE) Avoid TOCTOU race conditions while accessing files
Category.name: CERT_C-FIO45

Category.desc: CERT-FIO46_C (RULE) Do not access a closed file
Category.name: CERT_C-FIO46

Category.desc: CERT-FIO44_C (RULE) Only use values for fsetpos() that are returned from fgetpos()
Category.name: CERT_C-FIO44

Category.desc: CERT-STR37_C (RULE) Arguments to character-handling functions must be representable as an unsigned char

Category.desc: CERT-STR38_C (RULE) Do not confuse narrow and wide character strings and functions

Category.desc: CERT-FIO47_C (RULE) Use valid format strings
Category.name: CERT_C-FIO47

Category.desc: CERT-FIO41_C (RULE) Do not call getc(), putc(), getwc(), or putwc() with a stream argument that has side effects

Category.desc: CERT-FIO42_C (RULE) Close files when they are no longer needed

Category.desc: CERT-FIO40_C (RULE) Reset strings on fgets() or fgetws() failure

Category.desc: CERT-MSC32_C (RULE) Properly seed pseudorandom number generators

Category.desc: CERT-MSC33_C (RULE) Do not pass invalid data to the asctime() function
